title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large skillet until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and remove from heat.
Quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and parsley.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and half the tikka masala spices for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry marinated chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
Heat oil in a large pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add remaining tikka masala spices and cook for 30 seconds.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in cream and cooked chicken. Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: A green salad of romaine lettuce and croutons dressed with lemon juice, olive oil, egg, Worcestershire sauce, anchovies, garlic, Dijon mustard, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
instructions: In a food processor, blend anchovies, garlic, egg yolks, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
While blending, slowly drizzle in olive oil until emulsified.
Add Worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss romaine lettuce with the dressing.
Add croutons and toss again.
Top with shaved Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Seasoned ground beef served in crispy taco shells with lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
instructions: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium-high heat until browned.
Add diced onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in taco seasoning and 1/4 cup water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm taco shells according to package directions.
Fill each taco shell with seasoned beef.
Top with lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
Serve with sour cream on the side.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade cookies loaded with chocolate chips, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together butter and both sugars until fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
Gradually stir in flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden brown.
Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire rack.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A colorful mix of fresh vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce, served over rice.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli and carrots, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add bell peppers and snap peas, stir-fry for 2 more minutes.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Cook for 1 more minute until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Serve immediately over steamed rice.
